metadata.title: CVE-2020-25681 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in dnsmasq before version 2.83. A heap-based bufferoverflow was discovered in the way RRSets are sorted before validating withDNSSEC data. An attacker on the network, who can forge DNS replies such asthat they are accepted as valid, could use this flaw to cause a bufferoverflow with arbitrary data in a heap memory segment, possibly executingcode on the machine. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25681` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-base - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-base-lua - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.82-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.82-1ubuntu2').
